skill.name: jira
skill.description: Jira Cloud integration for issue management and search. This skill should be used when working with Jira tickets, searching issues with JQL, creating or updating issues, adding comments, or transitioning issue status. Covers REST API v3 and Jira Query Language.

skill.author: Joseph OBrien

security_audit.summary: Legitimate Jira Cloud API wrapper skill. Makes authenticated HTTP requests to Atlassian's official API endpoints. Only accesses credentials from environment variables and makes network calls to documented Jira REST API v3 endpoints. No code execution, shell commands, or suspicious data exfiltration patterns detected.

low_findings.title: Environment variable credential access
low_findings.description: The skill reads Jira credentials (JIRA_EMAIL, JIRA_API_TOKEN, JIRA_DOMAIN) from environment variables. This is necessary for Jira Cloud authentication but represents credential access. An attacker with access to the running process could potentially read these values. The credentials are used exclusively for authenticating requests to Atlassian's official Jira API endpoints.

content.value_statement: Managing Jira issues manually takes time away from development. This skill enables AI assistants to search, create, update, and transition Jira issues using natural language and JQL queries through the official REST API v3.
actual_capabilities: Search issues using JQL queries with filtering and sorting
Create and update issues with rich text descriptions in ADF format
Add comments and manage issue transitions between statuses
Assign issues to team members and manage labels
List projects and retrieve project details via REST API v3
Get issue details and transition workflows
limitations: Requires Jira Cloud with API token authentication
Only supports REST API v3 endpoints, not older versions
Does not manage Jira project boards or sprints directly
No built-in rate limiting for high-volume operations

use_cases.title: Track and update bug reports
use_cases.description: Quickly find assigned bugs, update status, and add reproduction steps to Jira tickets.

use_cases.title: Search and report on issues
use_cases.description: Run JQL queries to generate reports on sprint progress, blocker issues, and team workload.

use_cases.title: Automate issue workflows
use_cases.description: Create tickets for failed deployments and transition issues through deployment pipelines.

prompt_templates.title: Find my open issues
prompt_templates.prompt: Show me all my open issues in project PROJ that were updated in the last day

prompt_templates.title: Create bug ticket
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a new Bug issue in project PROJ with title 'Login fails with special characters' and description explaining the bug with reproduction steps

prompt_templates.title: Update issue status
prompt_templates.prompt: Transition issue PROJ-123 to 'In Progress' status and assign it to jsmith@company.com

prompt_templates.title: Generate sprint report
prompt_templates.prompt: Find all bugs in the current sprint, group them by priority, and list how many are still open versus done

output_examples.input: Show me high priority bugs assigned to me that are still open
output: PROJ-456: Memory leak in data processor - Priority: Highest - Status: Open
PROJ-789: Login timeout on mobile - Priority: High - Status: Open

best_practices: Store Jira credentials securely in environment variables or a dedicated secrets manager
Use specific JQL queries with project and status filters for faster results
Test ADF-formatted descriptions in Jira editor before using them in API calls
Check rate limit responses and implement backoff for high-volume operations
anti_patterns: Hardcoding API tokens in source code or sharing them in prompts
Making excessive API calls without caching or pagination
Ignoring 401/403 errors that indicate permission problems
Using broad JQL queries that return thousands of results without pagination

faq.question: Does this skill work with Jira Server or Data Center?
faq.answer: This skill is designed for Jira Cloud only and uses REST API v3 endpoints.

faq.question: What permissions does the Jira API token need?
faq.answer: The token needs access to the Jira projects you want to manage. Use an account with appropriate project permissions.

faq.question: Can I use this with self-hosted Jira instances?
faq.answer: Yes, if your instance uses Jira Cloud API v3 format. Update JIRA_DOMAIN to point to your server URL.

faq.question: Is my Jira data sent anywhere besides Atlassian?
faq.answer: No. All requests go directly to your configured Jira domain. No third-party services are involved.

faq.question: Why am I getting 401 errors?
faq.answer: Check that JIRA_EMAIL and JIRA_API_TOKEN are correctly set. Ensure the API token was generated at id.atlassian.com.

faq.question: How does this compare to the official Atlassian SDK?
faq.answer: This skill provides a lightweight wrapper for common operations. The official SDK offers more features and better error handling.
